definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Someone held that Qian's deeds were flagrantly anti-party.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为，钱三强是更加露骨地反对党的领导。

definition: Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer
Zhao Zhongyao (1902-1998), Chinese pioneer nuclear physicist
Lin Chia-Chiao (1916-2013), Chinese-American physicist, astronomer and applied mathematician
Li Siguang (1889-1971), Mongol-born, Japanese trained geologist, prominent in early PRC oil exploration
Tsung-Dao Lee (1926-), Chinese American physicist, Columbia University, 1957 Nobel laureate
(China's achievements of) producing an atomic bomb (1964) and hydrogen bomb (1967) and launching a satellite into space (1970)
Zhu Kezhen (1890-1974), Chinese metereologist and geologist

Samuel C. C. Ting (1936-), American physicist, 1976 Nobel Prize laureate in physics
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
